src.models package

Submodules

src.models.predict_model module

Batch Inference Script for RetailGenius.

This script loads a trained model from MLflow and generates predictions for a given input dataset. It is designed to be run from the command line.

Example

python src/models/predict_model.py \
    --model-uri runs:/<run_id>/model \
    --input data/processed/features.csv \
    --output data/processed/predictions.csv
src.models.predict_model.main()[source]

Main execution entry point.

  1. Parses arguments.

  2. Loads the input data CSV.

  3. Loads the specified model from MLflow.

  4. Generates predictions (classes).

  5. Saves the results to a new CSV file.

src.models.predict_model.parse_args()[source]

Parses command-line arguments for model inference.

Returns:

The parsed arguments containing:

  • model_uri (str): The MLflow URI of the model.

  • input (str): Path to input CSV.

  • output (str): Path to save output predictions.

Return type:

argparse.Namespace

src.models.train_model module

Training script for the Customer Churn Prediction model.

This module handles the end-to-end training pipeline, including: 1. Loading processed feature data. 2. Splitting data into training and testing sets. 3. Building a Scikit-Learn Pipeline (Imputation + Scaling + Logistic Regression). 4. Logging parameters, metrics, and the trained model artifact to MLflow.

Example

Run this script directly to train the baseline model:

$ python src/models/train_model.py

src.models.train_model.main()[source]

Main training routine.

Steps:

  1. Loads features from data/processed/features.csv.

  2. Splits data into train/test sets (80/20 split).

  3. Trains a LogisticRegression pipeline with Median Imputation.

  4. Logs accuracy, F1-score, and ROC-AUC to MLflow.

  5. Saves the model artifact to MLflow for later serving.

Raises:

ValueError – If the ‘Churn’ target column is missing from the input data.

src.models.train_xgb_model module

Training script for the Customer Churn Prediction model.

This module handles the end-to-end training pipeline, including: 1. Loading processed feature data. 2. Splitting data into training and testing sets. 3. Building a Pipeline (Imputation + XGBoost Classifier). 4. Logging parameters, metrics, and the trained model artifact to MLflow.

Example

Run this script directly to train the tree-based model:

$ python src/models/train_xgb_model.py

src.models.train_xgb_model.main()[source]

Main training routine.

Steps:

  1. Loads features from data/processed/features.csv.

  2. Splits data into train/test sets (80/20 split).

  3. Trains a XGBoost pipeline with Median Imputation.

  4. Logs accuracy, F1-score, and ROC-AUC to MLflow.

  5. Saves the model artifact to MLflow for later serving.

Raises:

ValueError – If the ‘Churn’ target column is missing from the input data.
